{{infobox character | people-duplicated=[[Easterlings (First Age)|Easterling]] | name=Ulfang | image=Liz Danforth - Ulfang.png | people=[[Easterlings (First Age)|Easterling (First Age)]] | caption="Ulfang" by [[Liz Danforth]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position=Chieftain of one of the [[Easterlings (First Age)|Easterling]] peoples | location=[[East Beleriand]] (''presumably'' [[Thargelion]]{{WJ|Beleriand}}, "Sheet 2: North-east", p. 183) | affiliation=[[Caranthir]] (''feigned'')
[[Morgoth]] | language= | birth=''Possibly'' {{FA|400}}[[Ulfang#Other versions of the legendarium|NB]] | birthlocation=East of [[Ered Luin]] | rule= | death=''Possibly'' {{FA|470}}[[Ulfang#Other versions of the legendarium|NB]] | deathlocation=[[East Beleriand]] | age=70 | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Uldor]]
[[Ulfast]]
[[Ulwarth]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Ulfang the Black''' was, along [[Bór]], one of the two greatest chieftains of the [[Easterlings (First Age)|Easterlings]] that moved into [[Beleriand]] during the late [[First Age]]. == History == After entering Beleriand at [[Morgoth]]'s bidding, Ulfang and his sons [[Uldor]], [[Ulfast]], and [[Ulwarth]] joined the service of [[Caranthir]]. They were given lands to dwell in the [[East Beleriand]].{{S|18}} However, unbeknownst to the [[sons of Fëanor]], Ulfang was secretly in the employ of Morgoth, and his sons betrayed the [[Eldar]] and the [[Edain]] during the disastrous [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]].{{S|20}} But though Morgoth was victorious in that battle, all three of Ulfang's sons were killed there. == Genealogy[[Ulfang#Other versions of the legendarium|NB]] == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | ULG | | | | |ULG='''ULFANG'''
''{{FA|400}} - {{FA|470|n}}''}} {{familytree| |,|-|-|-|+|-|-|-|.| |}} {{familytree| ULD | | ULF | | ULW |ULD=[[Uldor]]
''{{FA|425}} - {{FA|472|n}}''|ULF=[[Ulfast]]
''{{FA|428}} - {{FA|472|n}}''|ULW=[[Ulwarth]]
''{{FA|430}} - {{FA|472|n}}''}} {{familytree/end}} == Etymology and other names == The name ''Ulfang'' was probably not the character's true name, as it seems to be [[Sindarin]] for "Ugly Beard": ''[[ul-]]'' ("ugly") + ''[[fang]]'' ("beard").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3776770693.html|articlename=S. ''Ulfang'' m.|dated=|website=Eldamo|accessed=21 December 2019}} An earlier name for the character was ''Ulband'',See also: [[Ulbandi]], the [[Ogres|Ogre]] wife of [[Melko]] and the mother of [[Kosomot|Gothmog]] in the earliest version of the [[legendarium]]. which was quickly changed to ''Ulfand'',{{SM|7In}}, ''Note 30'', p. 311 and then finally to ''Ulfang''.{{LR|Quenta}}, "Of the Ruin of Beleriand and the Fall of Fingolfin", ''Of the Swarthy Men'', §151, pp. 286-7 == Other versions of the legendarium == Even though Ulfang was the instigator of the betrayal of the Easterlings, he is not mentioned to have taken part in the battle, and it is noted that his son Uldor was the leader of the treason. In the appendix of ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]'' in ''[[The Genealogies]]'' (dating from the early [[1930]]s), it is stated that Ulfand the Swart (an earlier name for ''Ulfang'') was born in the year 100, and died in 170.{{LR|A1}}, p. 403 When comparing the above dates with its associated text ''[[The Earliest Annals of Beleriand]]'', Ulfand died two years before the battle which started in 172.{{SM|7I}}, entry '''year 172''', pp. 301-2 Also, the dates found in ''The Earliest Annals of Beleriand'' were by and large moved 300 years into the future in ''[[The Grey Annals]]'' (c. early [[1950]]s), such that, for example, an event happening in the year 195 in ''The Earliest Annals'' now happened in the year {{FA|495|n}}.{{SM|7Ic}}, ''Annals 155 to 157'', pp. 319-20 {{references|notes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ulfang}} [[Category:Characters in The Silmarillion]] [[Category:Easterlings (First Age)]] [[Category:First Age characters]] [[Category:Noldorin names]] [[Category:Rulers in Beleriand]] [[Category:Servants of Melkor]] [[Category:Sindarin names]] [[de:Ulfang]] [[fi:Ulfang]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/hommes/1a/orientaux/ulfang]]
